{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "6a681d79a22c70556d8a8119962e800d6d260647",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/how-to-configure-domain-controllers.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 3,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-configure-domain-controllers.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-configure-domain-controllers.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-configure-domain-controllers.md?ref=0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814",
    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ author: kenwith\n ms.author: kenwith\n manager: dougeby\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 07/21/2025\n+ms.date: 09/24/2025\n ms.service: global-secure-access\n ms.subservice: entra-private-access\n ms.reviewer: shkhalid\n@@ -24,6 +24,7 @@ To configure Microsoft Entra Private Access for Active Directory Domain Controll\n - The client machine is at least Windows 10 and is Microsoft Entra joined or hybrid joined device. The client machine must also have line of sight to the private resources and DC (user is in a corporate network and accessing on-premises resources). User identity used for joining the device and accessing these resources was created in Active Directory (AD) and synced to Microsoft Entra ID using Microsoft Entra Connect.\n - The latest Microsoft Entra Private network connector is installed and has a line of sight to the DC.\n - Open inbound Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port `1337` in the Windows Firewall on the DCs.\n+- Ensure your firewall or proxy allows outbound connections to the wildcard domain suffix `*.msappproxy.net:443`. Private Access Sensor uses this secure channel to register and fetch policies from Microsoft's Entra cloud service.\n - Identify the Service Principal Names (SPNs) of the private apps you want to protect. You add these SPNs in the policy for Private Access Sensors that are installed on the DCs.\n > [!NOTE]\n > The SPNs are *case insensitive* and should be an *exact match* or a wildcard in the format `<serviceclass>/*` such as `cifs/*`."
  },
  {
    "sha": "67008be546f26ef92ceedcd98678d0082fadac59",
    "filename": "docs/identity/authentication/concept-fido2-compatibility.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 3,
    "deletions": 4,
    "changes": 7,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-fido2-compatibility.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-fido2-compatibility.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-fido2-compatibility.md?ref=0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814",
    "patch": "@@ -5,12 +5,12 @@ description: Web browser and native app support for FIDO2 passwordless authentic\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: authentication\n ms.topic: article\n-ms.date: 06/09/2025\n+ms.date: 09/24/2025\n \n author: justinha\n ms.author: justinha\n manager: dougeby\n-ms.reviewer: calui\n+ms.reviewer: kimhana\n ---\n # Passkey (FIDO2) authentication matrix with Microsoft Entra ID\n \n@@ -65,8 +65,7 @@ The following section covers support for passkey (FIDO2) authentication in web b\n \n ### Android\n - Sign-in with passkey requires Google Play Services 21 or later because Microsoft Entra ID requires user verification for multifactor authentication.\n-- BLE security keys aren't supported on Android by Google.\n-- Security key registration with Microsoft Entra ID isn't yet supported on Android.\n+- BLE and NFC security keys aren't supported on Android by Google.\n - Sign-in with passkey isn't supported in Firefox on Android.\n \n ## Known issues"
  },
  {
    "sha": "d79ead971f73501cd3ade2e58512c3d8651d8c34",
    "filename": "docs/identity/conditional-access/agent-optimization-review-suggestions.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 4,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization-review-suggestions.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization-review-suggestions.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fagent-optimization-review-suggestions.md?ref=0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814",
    "patch": "@@ -128,9 +128,9 @@ When the agent suggests a new policy, it creates the policy in report-only mode.\n > [!WARNING]\n > Policies in report-only mode that require a compliant device might prompt users on macOS, iOS, and Android devices to select a device certificate during policy evaluation, even though device compliance isn't enforced. These prompts might repeat until the device is compliant. To prevent end users from receiving prompts during sign-in, exclude device platforms Mac, iOS, and Android from report-only policies that perform device compliance checks.\n \n-## Review policy reports (Preview)\n+## Review policy reports\n \n-The Conditional Access optimization agent also detects spikes and dips in activity related to existing policies. These anomalies often indicate a misconfiguration of a policy that needs to be investigated. If the agent identifies a significant change in activity, a report appears in the list of suggestions. In the **Actions taken by agent** column, you'll see **Suggested policy review** as the value.\n+The Conditional Access optimization agent also detects spikes and dips in activity related to existing policies. These anomalies often indicate a misconfiguration of a policy that needs to be investigated. If the agent identifies a significant change in activity, a report appears in the list of suggestions. The reports apply to both active and report-only policies that the agent suggests turning on. In the **Actions taken by agent** column, you'll see **Suggested policy review** as the value.\n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n > The policy reports in the Conditional Access Optimization agent are currently in PREVIEW."
  },
  {
    "sha": "f240ae2facbda7d2ad4579c8aa3aa7fec99088bd",
    "filename": "docs/identity/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-insights-reporting.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 4,
    "deletions": 7,
    "changes": 11,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fhowto-conditional-access-insights-reporting.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fhowto-conditional-access-insights-reporting.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fhowto-conditional-access-insights-reporting.md?ref=0181e6a2510dd5d7c16b9b755ed6f69c80a49814",
    "patch": "@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@ description: Using the Microsoft Entra Conditional Access insights and reporting\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: conditional-access\n ms.topic: article\n-ms.date: 04/14/2025\n+ms.date: 09/24/2025\n ms.author: joflore\n author: MicrosoftGuyJFlo\n manager: dougeby\n@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ The Conditional Access insights and reporting workbook enables you to understand\n \n To enable the insights and reporting workbook, your tenant must have:\n \n-- A Log Analytics workspace to retain sign-in logs data. \n+- A Log Analytics workspace to retain sign-in logs data and access to that workspace. \n - Microsoft Entra ID P1 licenses to use Conditional Access.\n \n Users must have at least the Security Reader role assigned and Log Analytics workspace Contributor roles assigned.\n@@ -28,16 +28,13 @@ Users must have at least the Security Reader role assigned and Log Analytics wor\n \n ### Stream sign-in logs from Microsoft Entra ID to Azure Monitor logs\n \n-If you haven't integrated Microsoft Entra logs with Azure Monitor logs, you need to take the following steps before the workbook loads:\n-\n-1. [Create a Log Analytics workspace in Azure Monitor](/azure/azure-monitor/logs/quick-create-workspace).\n-1. [Integrate Microsoft Entra logs with Azure Monitor logs](../monitoring-health/howto-integrate-activity-logs-with-azure-monitor-logs.yml).\n+If you haven't integrated Microsoft Entra logs with Azure Monitor logs, you must [Integrate Microsoft Entra logs with Azure Monitor logs](../monitoring-health/howto-integrate-activity-logs-with-azure-monitor-logs.yml).\n \n ## How it works\n \n To access the insights and reporting workbook:\n \n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Security Reader](../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-reader).\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Security Reader](../role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#security-reader) and the [appropriate permissions to the Log Analytics workspace](/azure/azure-monitor/logs/manage-access#workspace-permissions).\n 1. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Conditional Access** > **Insights and reporting**.\n \n ### Get started: Select parameters "
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
The provided commit history shows updates to Microsoft Entra documentation.

Key changes include:

*   **Global Secure Access:** An update to the "how-to-configure-domain-controllers.md" document adds a requirement for allowing outbound connections to `*.msappproxy.net:443` for the Private Access Sensor. The document's modification date has also been updated.
*   **FIDO2 Compatibility:** The "concept-fido2-compatibility.md" document has had its modification date updated and a reviewer changed. Additionally, it clarifies that BLE and NFC security keys are not supported on Android by Google, and security key registration with Microsoft Entra ID is also not supported on Android.
*   **Conditional Access Agent Optimization:** Two documents related to Conditional Access agent optimization have been updated. "agent-optimization-review-suggestions.md" has had its title changed from "Review policy reports (Preview)" to "Review policy reports" and a minor wording adjustment. "howto-conditional-access-insights-reporting.md" has seen its modification date updated, a reviewer updated, and the prerequisites for using the insights and reporting workbook clarified to include access to the Log Analytics workspace, along with appropriate permissions for both the security reader role and the workspace.

ai_summary.Response: The document `agent-optimization-review-suggestions.md` has been updated. The title of the section "Review policy reports (Preview)" has been shortened to "Review policy reports" to remove the "(Preview)" tag. Additionally, the description for this section has been clarified to explicitly state that the reports apply to both active and report-only policies that the agent suggests enabling.

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates a documentation file concerning FIDO2 (passkey) authentication with Microsoft Entra ID. The date of the document has been advanced, and a reviewer has been changed. Additionally, the document now clarifies that BLE and NFC security keys are not supported on Android by Google, a point previously made separately for BLE.

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the documentation for Microsoft Entra Conditional Access insights and reporting. The changes refine the prerequisites by clarifying the need for access to the Log Analytics workspace and by updating the date. Additionally, the instructions for integrating sign-in logs with Azure Monitor logs have been simplified, and the required user permissions for accessing the workbook are now more precisely stated.

ai_summary.Response:
This commit modifies the "Conditional Access insights and reporting" documentation. The primary changes include:

*   Updating the `ms.date` from April 14, 2025, to September 24, 2025.
*   Clarifying that access to the Log Analytics workspace is required, in addition to the workspace itself.
*   Simplifying the instructions for integrating Microsoft Entra logs with Azure Monitor logs, directing users to a single article.
*   Adding a requirement for users to have appropriate permissions to the Log Analytics workspace when accessing the insights and reporting workbook.
